recipe_name: Honey-roasted fig and red onion crostini
author: Paul Rankin
method: Preheat the oven to 200C/400F/Gas 6. Heat the olive oil in a pan, add the red onion and fry over a gentle heat for five minutes until softened. Add the garlic and sugar and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add the balsamic vinegar and cook for three minutes. Place the halved fig onto a baking sheet and drizzle with honey. Roast for five minutes in the oven. To serve, spread the caramelised onions onto the toasted baguette slices and top with the honey-roasted figs.
ingredients: 1 tbsp olive oil,  Â¼ red onion, finely sliced,  1 garlic clove, chopped,  1 tsp soft brown sugar,  2 tsp balsamic vinegar,  1 fig, halved,  1 tbsp clear honey,  2 slices baguette, toasted
